moves.1. d4 d6 2. Nf3 f6: Weird, but playable (?). It strikes right to the center, but cramps black a lot.
moves.3. Bf4: My "standard" following, maybe not the best.
moves.5. h4: Wrong move, in this context. h3 was much better.
moves.5... g4 6. Nh2: Nd2 was playable and good. But it slowed white's developement, and I wanted a witty game.
moves.6... b6 7. Qd3: ...so I can play this at once (not after Nd2). After Rh6, Bf4 and white has an edge, despite the useless knight.
moves.7... c5 8. Qg6+ Kd7: Reached goal. Now, what? This is the dangerous moment. White is not ready for a real attack, so I must be careful.
moves.9. dxc5 bxc5 10. e3: Opening lines for the lsb without blocking a possible queen's replacement.
moves.10... Qa5+ 11. Nc3: I calculated that after o-o-o, black has not enough developement to take advantage from the b column, so my knight will be free soon.
moves.11... Bb7: The plan f3 was the most logical, but I wanted to play aggressively, and without giving it a good thinking (you know, blitz, unrated games :-)...
moves.12. Bc4: If Bxg2, Qf7 "must" get something in return for the rook. Of course, not sure at all.
moves.13. O-O-O: smarter. I love when I can castle attacking.
moves.14. Qf7+ Be7: this or Ne7, to save the bishop.
moves.15. Qg7: Pretty dull and naive, but I couldn't figure out so quickly another way of attack. I was thinking about Nxd5, taking advantage of the pin, but I wasn't sure about it at all.
moves.15... Nc6: ?? NOW it was Nxd5, for sure.
moves.16. Qxh8: Bleah, the naive one... still I couldn't see any countertrick, but in fact there was one.
moves.16... Bd6: If Q gives check, it only helps his knight to e7.
moves.18. Qxh5: Well, at least I can try to free my knight. I was really unsure about how to go on, but now Nxd5 seemed even more dangerous.
moves.18... f5: Hmpf. Ok, now what is the B plan? (Nxd5 was still good).
moves.19... Ne5: Gloam, this happens only in blitz games.
moves.20. Qg7 Nxc4 21. Qxb7: Keeping the material advantage... but feeling ashamed.
moves.21... Nb6: No danger of a blocked queen... just now.
moves.22... fxe4 23. Nxe4+ Ke5: Ahh.. the kind of position I love to play. What's the mate net here? I didn't have time to think, remember.
moves.24. Qc7+: Attraction. By taking the knight, my other rook can enter into the game.
moves.24... Kxe4 25. Rhe1+: Maybe better was Qf7, after which this is mate.
moves.25... Kf5 26. Qf7+ Nf6 27. Qxe6+ Kg6: Nxg4 was obvious, but I love attraction.
moves.28. h5+: If Kxh, Re5+ brings more material into the net.
moves.28... Kg7 29. Qe7+ Kh6: Better was Kg8, but with no hopes.
moves.30. Qxf6+ Kxh5 31. Re5#: So I felt the emotion of a tactical win. Good for the morning... now, back to work, to reality and... to "good" chess :-)
